page.title: 19INDUSTRY IN MAREFIELD
page.content: {LIVERY STABLES Horses are stabled here for their owners during the hunting season. {JAM AND MARMALADE MAKING. A thriving cottage industry has developed here producing preserves which are sent to W.I. Markets in all parts of the country. Initially all the work was done by the owner but as demand grew local housewives were brought in to help in Jan/Feb when Seville oranges are available and have to be washed, minced and frozen ready for use throughout the year. Products include- 3 kinds of marmalade, lemon curd, and apple preserve and chutney. {DONKEY STUD FARM Donkeys for showing, are bred on a small holding here. There are only mares and foals at present as the male donkey caused a nuisance to neighbours with its continual braying.
